headline: Multi-state Anti-trust Climate Initiatives Lawsuit Gets Greenlight - New Climate Science Report that Rejects Crisis Buried by MSM says Friends of Science Society
summary: As reported by Reuters on Aug. 01, 2025, a US judge rejected efforts by Blackrock and other fund managers to dismiss a multi-state lawsuit wherein, "Asset managers [are] accused of violating antitrust law via climate activism. Outcome may affect $27 trillion in managed assets," says Friends of Science Society.

headline: Tevogen Sees Significant Institutional Ownership Growth; 73% of Holders Increase Positions
summary: WARREN, N.J., Aug. 06, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Tevogen (“Tevogen Bio Holdings Inc.” or “Company”) (Nasdaq: TVGN), today announced an update on institutional ownership of the Company’s outstanding common stock, as reported by institutional investment managers on Form 13F filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). headline: Apollo buys majority stake in Stream Data Centers
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Apollo agreed to buy a majority interest in Stream Data Centers (SDC), the alternative asset manager said on Wednesday, in a bet on rising demand for digital infrastructure fueled by artificial intelligence and cloud computing.  Investors are lining up to put money into data centers, as demand for computing power soars.  SDC builds, leases, manages and operates huge campuses and has delivered more than 20 to date, Apollo said in a statement.

headline: Caledonia Mining Corporation Plc: Notification of relevant change to significant shareholder
summary: ST HELIER, Jersey, Aug. 06, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Caledonia Mining Corporation Plc ("Caledonia" or "the Company") (NYSE AMERICAN: CMCL; AIM: CMCL; VFEX: CMCL) announces that it received notification on August 5, 2025 from BlackRock, Inc. that on August 4, 2025 it had crossed a threshold for notification of a relevant change (as defined by the AIM Rules for Companies). A copy of the notification is below. Enquiries: Caledonia Mining Corporation PlcMark LearmonthCamilla HorsfallTel: +44 1534 67

headline: Bitcoin ETFs Bleed Millions for 4th Straight Day as U.S. Stagflation Fears Weigh on BTC and Stocks
summary: Investors withdrew $196 million from U.S.-listed bitcoin ETFs on Tuesday, while pouring money into ether ETFs.

raw.headline: Bitcoin ETFs Bleed Millions for 4th Straight Day as U.S. Stagflation Fears Weigh on BTC and Stocks
